intro: Pimelea ligustrina var. macrostegia, commonly known as the broad-stemmed mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sandy soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while the flowers are clustered in dense, spherical heads. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is often used in coastal gardens for its ornamental value.
